text: The main component of the first generation computer was
explanation: Vacuum tubes(also known as electronic valves) were used in the first generations of computers. These computer systems made use of vacuum tubes as storage circuits and electromagnetic drums.

text: The term Garbage-In-Garbage-Out is used to explain the characteristics of the computer in terms of
The number 101100101\(2\) in denary is
Which of the following statements is true?

options.A: Data leads to information and information leads to knowledge
options.B: Data leads to knowledge and knowledge leads to information
options.C: Information leads to data and data leads to knowledge
options.D: Knowledge leads to information and information leads to data

explanation: The correct statement is that data leads to information and information leads to knowledge.

text: The type of computer that counts in discrete form only is referred to as
explanation: Digital computers represent data as discrete signals, which means that data is represented using binary digits or bits, which have a value of either 0 or 1.

text: Which of the following media involves point-to-point communication?
explanation: The term point-to-point telecommunications means a wireless data link between two fixed points. The telecommunications signal is typically bi-directional and either time division multiple access or channelized e.g. telephone call.

text: Fourth generation computer application can execute the following operations except
explanation: Fourth-generation computer applications cannot execute the operation of "digging of drainages". This is because fourth-generation computers are software-based and designed for specific applications that focus on data manipulation, report generation, and analysis.

text: The joystick is mainly used for

options.A: clicking the links on web pages
options.D: typing of document in a word processor

explanation: A joystick is also known as the control column. The joystick is an input device mostly used for gaming applications and, sometimes, in graphics applications.

text: The manipulation of digitalized information by computer or other electronic equipment is known as
explanation: Information processing refers to the manipulation of digitized information by computers and other digital electronic equipment, known collectively as information technology(IT)

text: Which of the following actions is not a source of computer virus?
explanation:
The sources of computer viruses are:
Downloading Programs. ...Pirated or Cracked Software.Email Attachments. ...Internet.Booting Data from Unknown CDs. ...Bluetooth. ...Unpatched Software.Infected disk of a flash drive.

text: When information is conveyed from one space to another, it is referred to as information
Which of the following file organizations requires primary Key?
explanation: An indexed file is a file in which each record includes a primary key. To distinguish one record from another, the value of the primary key must be unique for each record. Records can then be accessed randomly by specifying the value of the record's primary key.

text: The protocol for transferring file(s) from one machine to another is
explanation: FTP (File Transfer Protocol) is a protocol used to transfer files between clients and servers on a network.

text: Mr Francis has an office complex with 20 rooms. What type of network is suitable for connecting all the computers in their various rooms into a single network?
explanation: ALAN( local area network) would be suitable for connecting all the computers in these rooms into a single network.

To visit the previous page using the interface in Figure 1, the user will click on the part labeled
explanation:
To visit the previous page using the interface inFigure 1,the user will click on the part labeled II.
The back button is a user interface feature that takes a user back to their previous location. For instance, clicking the back button in an internet browser takes you back to the last web page you visited. The back button only works if there is a previous page in your browser history.

The field in a database which uniquely identifies each record is called a
The correct order of the steps taken in creating a database from the database template in MS Access 2007 is

options.A: click on the Office button --> click New --> choose a database of your choice
options.B: click New --> click on Office button --> choose a database of your choice
options.C: click on database of your choice --> click New --> click on Office button
options.D: click New --> choose database of your choice --> click on Office button

explanation:
To Create a database in MS Access 2007
click on the Office buttonIf Access is already open, select File > New.Select Blank database, or select a template.Enter a name for the database, select a location, and then select Create.
Therefore,  the correct order is:Office button --> New --> Choose a database template --> Create

text: To show the whole presentation in Microsoft PowerPoint 2007, select slide show from the
explanation: To show the whole presentation in Microsoft PowerPoint 2007, select slide show from the menu bar.

One precautionary measure taken when cleaning a monitor is

options.B: spraying a windows cleaner on the monitor
options.D: using a vacuum cleaner to clean the monitor casing

text: The erratic movement of the mouse pointer is usually caused by
explanation: The erratic movement of the mouse pointer is usually caused by issues such as dirty mouse sensors, interference from other devices, a malfunctioning mouse, or problems with the surface on which the mouse is used.

text: The use of the internet to perform illegal activities is generally called
explanation: Cybercrime can be defined as “The illegal usage of any communication device to commit or facilitate in committing any illegal act”. Examples are Phishing and Scam, Identity Theft, Hacking/Misusing Computer Networks, and Internet Fraud.

text: One safety measure to consider in a computer room is

options.A: arranging the chairs in the room together

text: Security breaches in computing cannot be prevented through the use of
explanation:
A. Antivirus: Protects against malware and viruses.
B. Encryption: Secures data by making it unreadable to unauthorized users.
C. Firewall: Monitors and controls incoming and outgoing network traffic based on security rules.
D. Firmware: While it can have security features, it is primarily the software that controls hardware. It does not directly prevent security breaches by itself.
Therefore, Option D is correct.

efficiency/high speed and reliabilitylower overall costeasy retrievalservice improvementeconomical etc.
